main event: Several control tower operators at Albany Airport in Georgia observed an unidentified object traveling at high speed and making a sharp turn on January 24, 1953.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar, changing altitude from 20,000 to 30,000 feet during the observation.
After losing visual contact, the object was tracked on radar for several minutes before contact was lost.
The report was approved by Lieutenant General Walter Bedell Smith, Assistant Chief of Staff, G-2.
The document is marked as 'UNCLASSIFIED' and 'DOWNGRADED AT 3 YEAR INTERVALS DECLASSIFIED AFTER 12 YEARS. DOD DIR 5200.10'.
The report is from the United States, specifically from Albany, Georgia.
